events.title: Search Efforts Continue as X.10 Encounters Calm in Sandoy Fiord After Recovery Mission
events.description: 85. Recovery position F.B. was reached about 2300Z on 23rd September and a search was carried out. X.10 patrolled in the viciniiy of the recovery position all day 24th September, spending some time on the surface in the hope of being sighted; and that night she carried out a further search. At 0430Z on 25th September, when no contact had been made, X.Io set course for Sandoy Fiord, on the northern coast of Soroy Island. This was reached at 12002 and by 1525Z X%.Io was secured alongside the beach in Ytre Reppafiord, on the northwest of Sandoy Fiord. This bay was completely deserted and here the crew got some much needed rest. .

events.title: Enemy Air Raid Targets Submarine Base in Polyarnoe: Senior Officer Reports Possible Link to Operation Source
events.description: 103. Senior British Naval Officer, North Russia has stated in a monthly report of proceedings that there was an enemy air raid on Polyarnoe on the 24th September, apparently directed agaist the submarine base.  This may have been in connection with Operation   Source  , and it is considered not unlikely that the enemy thought the X-craft were operated from Kola Inlet.

events.title: Key Naval Operation: H.M.S. Breconshire and Eight Vessels Successfully Navigate to Malta
events.description: tion, which was designed to secure the passage of H.M.S. BRECONSHIRE* and 8 M.T. ships. to Malta, have been dealt with in previous reports of proceedings. This report deals with the period from r800A on 24th September (D.- 1x) until the completion of the operation.
